channel.title: Posts - Hugo Theme Deck
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Hugo Theme Deck

item.title: Steve Yegge's Vibe Coding Manifesto
item.description:
This is one of the most insightful discussions on the future of coding I’ve heard recently. Steve Yegge argues that we are moving away from traditional IDEs towards a “Vibe Coding” era where AI agents handle the bulk of implementation.

He critiques current tools for being “too safe” and suggests we need to embrace a more chaotic, high-level directive approach. It’s not just about autocomplete; it’s about architectural delegation.

“The vibes are off.” ‚Äî Steve Yegge

item.title: The best way to predict the future is to invent it
item.description: Additional context or notes about this quote can be added here, but won’t be displayed in the quote column.

item.title: The Pragmatic Programmer
item.description: A comprehensive review of this programming classic…

item.title: TIL: Hugo's Page Resources
item.description:
Today I learned that Hugo’s Page Resources feature allows you to co-locate images and other assets with your content files.

This makes it easier to organize and maintain your content, as all related files are kept together.

item.title: Welcome to Hugo Theme Deck
item.description:
Welcome to the Hugo Theme Deck! This theme is designed to be clean, modern, and easy to use.

Features

  • Multiple content types (Write, Quote, Now, Read, TIL)
  • Dark mode support
  • Responsive design
  • RSS feed
  • SEO optimized
  • Image lazy loading
  • Tag support

Getting Started

  1. Install Hugo
  2. Create a new site
  3. Add this theme
  4. Configure your site
  5. Start writing!

item.title: Working on improving the Hugo Theme Deck
item.description: Working on improving the Hugo Theme Deck documentation and adding more example posts to demonstrate different column styles. üöÄ

item.title: Write Column Example
item.description:
This is a summary paragraph that will be shown in the write column card. It should be concise and informative, giving readers a quick overview of the article.

Markdown Features

Here’s a demonstration of various markdown features that work in the single post view:

Text Formatting

  • Bold text for emphasis
  • Italic text for subtle emphasis
  • Inline code for technical terms

Code Blocks

def hello_world():
    print("Hello, World!")

Lists and Quotes

  1. First item
  2. Second item
  3. Third item

This is a blockquote that shows how quotes look in the article.
